isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Intake Restriction Test

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if the air cleaner is restricted.

note.para: High restriction will cause low power, poor fuel economy, and may cause excessive black or blue smoke when starting the engine. Also, high air cleaner restriction can cause turbocharger seals to unseat, allowing oil to be drawn in around seals and into the engine.
See Operation and Maintenance Manual, for details about the air intake system and air cleaner restriction indicators.

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in the front of this manual before doing the following procedures.

step1.para: Check for loose hoses and clamps.

caution.para: Leaks (unfiltered air) between the air cleaner and suction side of the turbocharger can cause damage to the turbocharger and engine parts.

step1.para: Check air cleaner housing for cracks.
Check Air to Air Cooler for holes and damage.
Check air cleaner elements for damaged gaskets or dents.
Check air cleaner restriction indicator or gauge.

svcsubproc.title: Dual Element Cleaner
svcsubproc.para: The dual element air cleaner has a large primary (outer) filter element and an optional small secondary (inner) filter element. The secondary element is used in dusty environments.

The restriction connection for the dual element air cleaner is between the primary and the secondary element at the bottom of the air cleaner housing. This allows only the primary (outer) element to be sensed by the restriction indicator or dash mounted vacuum gauge. Restriction for the inner element is not recorded on the restriction indicator or dash mounted vacuum gauge.

note.para: Dual element air cleaners use one of the following restriction indicators:

figure.caption: Dual element air cleaner with indicator in end capTighten retaining nut to 60-75 in·lbs (6.8-8.5 N·m)

note.para: Replace the element when the green dot disappears from the element end cap.

figure.caption: Dual element air cleaner retaining nut indicator Tighten retaining nut to 120 in·lbs (13.6 N·m)

note.para: Replace the element when the green dot disappears from the window in the retaining nut.

svcsubproc.title: Procedure to Measure Intake Air Restriction

step1.para: Attach a restriction test tool to the air cleaner housing tap.
Run engine at high idle rpm (no load).
Replace the air cleaner element when the test gauge shows a restriction greater than 12.5 in H 2O (3.13 kPa).

note.para: Equivalent Test using the dash mounted restriction gauge: The true maximum air cleaner restriction -25 in H 2O (6.22 kPa) -can only be obtained when operating the engine at full load and rated horsepower.

item.para: Snow, plastic bags, or foreign material may restrict air flow in the air cleaner inlet. Repaired engines may have rags or cap plugs in the intake system.
